      • setSimulationStrategy

        public void setSimulationStrategy​(int strategy)
        Description copied from interface: TransitionGraph
        Set the simulation strategy to use. This will determine how the simulation is performed, and which extra components are available.

        The strategy can be one of the following:

        • SimulationParameters.STRATEGY_STG: the default strategy, which uses the state transition graph (STG) to simulate the system.
        • SimulationParameters.STRATEGY_MDD: the MDD strategy, which uses the MDD to simulate the system.
        Specified by:
        setSimulationStrategy in interface TransitionGraph<HierarchicalNode,​DecisionOnEdge>

      • getSimulationStrategy

        public int getSimulationStrategy()
        Description copied from interface: TransitionGraph
        Get the current simulation strategy. This will return one of the following:
        • SimulationParameters.STRATEGY_STG: the default strategy, which uses the state transition graph (STG) to simulate the system.
        • SimulationParameters.STRATEGY_MDD: the MDD strategy, which uses the MDD to simulate the system.
        • SimulationParameters.STRATEGY_SCCG: the Strongly Connected Components Graph, which uses the SCC to simulate the system.
        Specified by:
        getSimulationStrategy in interface TransitionGraph<HierarchicalNode,​DecisionOnEdge>
        Returns:
        the current simulation strategy
